channel.description: Chapter 3 - Ad-Hoc Commands In the previous chapter, we ended our exploration of local infrastructure testing with Vagrant by creating a very simple Ansible playbook. Earlier still, we used a simple ansible ad-hoc command to run a one-off command on a remote server. We’ll dive deeper into playbooks in coming chapters; for now, we’ll explore how Ansible helps you quickly perform common tasks on, and gather data from, one or many servers with ad-hoc commands.
